semantic_title: Possible, Probable, Suspected, or Rule Out Diagnoses POA Assignment
section_path: Present on Admission Guidelines > Assigning the POA Indicator > Conditions documented as possible, probable, suspected, or rule out at the time of discharge

content.full_text: If the final diagnosis contains a possible, probable, suspected, or rule out diagnosis, and this diagnosis was based on signs, symptoms or clinical findings suspected at the time of inpatient admission, assign 'Y.' If the final diagnosis contains a possible, probable, suspected, or rule out diagnosis, and this diagnosis was based on signs, symptoms or clinical findings that were not present on admission, assign 'N'. (Evidence: pg no: 119, L43-L44)
content.summary: For possible/probable/suspected/rule out diagnoses, assign Y if based on admission findings, N if based on post-admission findings (Evidence: pg no: 119, L43-L44)
key_concepts: Rule out diagnoses (Evidence: pg no: 119, L43)
Based on admission findings (Evidence: pg no: 119, L43-L44)
Based on post-admission findings (Evidence: pg no: 119, L44)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign Y for possible/probable/suspected/rule out diagnoses based on admission findings (Evidence: pg no: 119, L43-L44)
detailed_rules.explanation: When final diagnosis is possible/probable/suspected/rule out and is based on signs, symptoms, or clinical findings present at admission, assign Y (Evidence: pg no: 119, L43-L44)
common_applications: Rule out MI based on admission chest pain
Suspected pneumonia based on admission symptoms

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign N for possible/probable/suspected/rule out diagnoses based on post-admission findings (Evidence: pg no: 119, L44)
detailed_rules.explanation: When final diagnosis is possible/probable/suspected/rule out and is based on signs, symptoms, or clinical findings not present at admission, assign N (Evidence: pg no: 119, L44)
common_applications: Suspected infection based on post-admission fever
Rule out complication based on post-admission symptoms

workflow_steps: Step 2: Determine what findings the diagnosis is based on
Step 3: Check if findings were present at admission
Step 4: Assign Y if present at admission, N if not

coding_scenarios.scenario: Rule out MI based on admission chest pain
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Admission: Chest pain. Discharge: Rule out myocardial infarction based on admission chest pain
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify rule out MI diagnosis
Step 2: Note it's based on admission chest pain
Step 3: Assign Y because based on admission findings

correct_coding.primary_code: Rule out MI with Y indicator
correct_coding.rationale: Rule out diagnosis based on admission findings (Evidence: pg no: 119, L43-L44)

incorrect_coding.code: Rule out MI with N indicator
incorrect_coding.rationale: Should assign Y when based on admission findings
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Not considering what findings the diagnosis is based on

warnings: Must determine what findings the uncertain diagnosis is based on (Evidence: pg no: 119, L43-L44)
best_practices: Review what clinical findings support the uncertain diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 119, L43-L44)
common_mistakes: Not considering the basis for uncertain diagnoses (Evidence: pg no: 119, L43-L44)
tips: Look for connection between diagnosis and supporting findings (Evidence: pg no: 119, L43-L44)
implementation_notes: Train coders to identify basis for uncertain diagnoses
clinical_context: Many diagnoses remain uncertain at discharge
